eu.ehri.project.persistence

Class ActionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.ehri.project.persistence.ActionManager

  • public final class ActionManager
extends Object
    Class for dealing with actions.

    Events are captured as a linked list with new events placed at the head. The head event is connected to a node called the SystemEventQueue. Events can have subjects (the thing the event is happening to) and actioners (the person initiating the event.) A subject's events and an actioner's actions likewise for a linked list so it is possible to fetch new events easily and prevent having to sort by timestamp, etc. Schematically, the graph thus formed looks something like: 

     
 Actioner              SystemEventQueue             Subject
 \/                        \/                      \/
 [lifecycleAction]     [lifecycleActionStream]     [lifecycleEvent]
 |                         |                       |
 e3--[actionHasEvent]->-- Event 3 ---[hasEvent]--<--e3
 \/                        \/                      \/
 [lifecycleAction]         [lifecycleAction]       [lifecycleEvent]
 |                         |                       |
 e2--[actionHasEvent]->-- Event 2 ---[hasEvent]--<--e2
 \/                        \/                      \/
 [lifecycleAction]         [lifecycleAction]       [lifecycleEvent]
 |                         |                       |
 e1--[actionHasEvent]->-- Event 1 ---[hasEvent]--<--e1

      • canAggregate

        public static boolean canAggregate(SystemEvent event1,
                                   SystemEvent event2,
                                   int timeDiffInSeconds)
        Determine if two events are the same according to the following definition:

        1. They have the same scope and subject
        2. They have the same actioner
        3. They are both of the same type
        4. They have the same log message, if any

        This function allows filtering an event stream for duplicates, like someone repeatedly updating the same item.

        Parameters:
        event1 - the first event
        event2 - the second event
        timeDiffInSeconds - the elapsed time between the events
        Returns:
        whether or not the events are effectively the same.

      • sequentialWithSameAccessor

        public static boolean sequentialWithSameAccessor(SystemEvent first,
                                                 SystemEvent second)
        Test if two events are sequential with the same actioner. This is used for aggregating repeated events.
        Parameters:
        first - the first temporal event
        second - the second temporal event
        Returns:
        whether events can be aggregated by user
